At its core this might be a semantic argument, but I wouldn't automatically equate the way the IFS works with Riot's policy. If Riot's policy and the judgments made by the IFS were one and the same they would not revert punishments issued by it at all. And as a matter of fact other people in similar situations as OP's have had their punishment reverted or at least reduced.
So at the very least I wouldn't call you "very correct".

Tyler1 being unbanned is quite a different matter, btw. Not only because we're talking about an entirely different form of punishment, but also because of what the decision to unban actually means:

If somebody appeals their punishment and the punishment is then lifted or reduced, that means Riot is reverting their decision. They made the decision to issue a punishment, that decision was then considered bad, so it was replaced by a new decision.

Tyler1 has been **indefinitely** banned. And in this context "indefinite" really just means "until we decide the punishment is over". Unbanning him is exactly that decision. Riot isn't reverting the original decision to punish Tyler1, they have just decided that the punishment has been served.
If Riot actually made the decision that the original punishment was not warranted they'd also unban his accounts.

If you go to Riot's website, at :
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201898070-My-Account-is-Suspended#h1q2

you will see, that they state it as that: 

CAN MY SUSPENSION BE REMOVED?
_"Suspensions due to the Instant Feedback System will not be lifted or shortened under any circumstance."_

That, to me, implies, that Riot has a zero tolerance policy on bans resulting from the IFS. Wouldn't you agree, that this is exactly what's said here?
Now we both know that Riot themselves are lying here, because there are numerous instances where they did lift a ban that resulted from the IFS.

But the point I'm making here is: You know how the IFS works.
You know what happens when you type words that trigger the IFS.
You know what to expect when you type those words.
You cannot tell me you were so naive that you didn't know that.

So why do it and then whine on the forums and beg for an unban? That's the point I don't get.
